funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.utilities

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.utilities.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains several utility methods such as sorting or averaging arrays

    These methods will more than likely be refactored into more specific classes in the near future.

    • Method Detail

      • ansiBands

        public static double[] ansiBands(int N,
                                 int bands)
        Returns the center frequencies of the Octave-Band and Fractional-Octave-Band filter frequencies according to the ANSI Specification .
        Parameters:
        N - the fractional octave band to compute, i.e. 3 for 1/3 octave bands
        bands - the number of filter bands to compute
        Returns:
        an array containing the center frequency of each 1/N octave band

      • ansiBandLimits

        public static double[] ansiBandLimits(int N,
                                      int bands)
        Returns the band limit frequencies of the Octave-Band and Fractional-Octave-Band filter frequencies according to the ANSI Specification .
        Parameters:
        N - the fractional octave band to compute, i.e. 3 for 1/3 octave bands
        bands - the number of filter bands to compute
        Returns:
        an array of length bands+1 containing the upper and lower band limit frequency of each 1/N octave band

      • max

        public static float max(float[] data)
        Find the maximum of an array
        Parameters:
        data - the array
        Returns:
        the maximum value in the array

        public static int maxLoc(float[] data)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the index location of the maximum value in the array

        public static float avgArray(float[] data)
        Find the average of an array
        Parameters:
        data - the array
        Returns:
        the average of all the values in the array

      • findHighestPeaks

        public static int[] findHighestPeaks(float[] data,
                                     int numPeaks)
        Find the N highest peaks in an array
        Parameters:
        data - the array
        numPeaks - the number of peaks to find
        Returns:
        the highest peaks in the array, in descending order

      • findLowestPeaks

        public static int[] findLowestPeaks(float[] data,
                                    int numPeaks)
        Find the N lowest peaks in an array
        Parameters:
        data - the array
        numPeaks - the number of peaks to find
        Returns:
        the lowest peaks in the array, in ascending order

      • findOrderedPeaks

        public static int[] findOrderedPeaks(float[] data,
                                     int numPeaks)
        Find the first N peaks in an array
        Parameters:
        data - the array
        numPeaks - the number of peaks to find
        Returns:
        the first peaks in the array, in the order they appear

      • isAndroid

        public static boolean isAndroid()
        Are we currently running on Android, or regular Java?
        Returns:
        true if app is running on DVM (Android) and false if running on JVM (Java)
